channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: How Far Are We From AGI
item.description: The evolution of artificial intelligence (AI) has profoundly impacted human society, driving significant advancements in multiple sectors.

item.title: 4D Panoptic Scene Graph Generation
item.description: To facilitate research in this new area, we build a richly annotated PSG-4D dataset consisting of 3K RGB-D videos with a total of 1M frames, each of which is labeled with 4D panoptic segmentation masks as well as fine-grained, dynamic scene graphs.

item.title: DiverGen: Improving Instance Segmentation by Learning Wider Data Distribution with More Diverse Generative Data
item.description: Instance segmentation is data-hungry, and as model capacity increases, data scale becomes crucial for improving the accuracy.

item.title: Revealing Hierarchical Structure of Leaf Venations in Plant Science via Label-Efficient Segmentation: Dataset and Method
item.description: Hierarchical leaf vein segmentation is a crucial but under-explored task in agricultural sciences, where analysis of the hierarchical structure of plant leaf venation can contribute to plant breeding.

item.title: CatCMA : Stochastic Optimization for Mixed-Category Problems
item.description: CatCMA updates the parameters of the joint probability distribution in the natural gradient direction.

item.title: Whole-Song Hierarchical Generation of Symbolic Music Using Cascaded Diffusion Models
item.description: A cascaded diffusion model is trained to model the hierarchical language, where each level is conditioned on its upper levels.

item.title: Revisiting Deep Audio-Text Retrieval Through the Lens of Transportation
item.description: The Learning-to-match (LTM) framework proves to be an effective inverse optimal transport approach for learning the underlying ground metric between two sources of data, facilitating subsequent matching.

item.title: Unsupervised Extractive Dialogue Summarization in Hyperdimensional Space
item.description: We present HyperSum, an extractive summarization framework that captures both the efficiency of traditional lexical summarization and the accuracy of contemporary neural approaches.

item.title: Towards Task-Compatible Compressible Representations
item.description: We evaluate the impact of this idea in the context of input reconstruction more rigorously and extended it to other computer vision tasks.

item.title: PL-MTEB: Polish Massive Text Embedding Benchmark
item.description: In this paper, we introduce the Polish Massive Text Embedding Benchmark (PL-MTEB), a comprehensive benchmark for text embeddings in Polish.

item.title: Hierarchical Attention Graph for Scientific Document Summarization in Global and Local Level
item.description: The long input hinders the simultaneous effective modeling of both global high-order relations between sentences and local intra-sentence relations which is the most critical step in extractive summarization.

item.title: LeMeViT: Efficient Vision Transformer with Learnable Meta Tokens for Remote Sensing Image Interpretation
item.description: Experimental results in classification and dense prediction tasks show that LeMeViT has a significant $1. 7 \times$ speedup, fewer parameters, and competitive performance compared to the baseline models, and achieves a better trade-off between efficiency and performance.

item.title: Generative Unlearning for Any Identity
item.description: In the generative identity unlearning, we target the following objectives: (i) preventing the generation of images with a certain identity, and (ii) preserving the overall quality of the generative model.

item.title: Scalarisation-based risk concepts for robust multi-objective optimisation
item.description: Robustification refers to the strategy that is used to marginalise over the uncertainty in the problem.

item.title: DiffAM: Diffusion-based Adversarial Makeup Transfer for Facial Privacy Protection
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel face protection approach, dubbed DiffAM, which leverages the powerful generative ability of diffusion models to generate high-quality protected face images with adversarial makeup transferred from reference images.

item.title: Beyond Static Calibration: The Impact of User Preference Dynamics on Calibrated Recommendation
item.description: Calibration in recommender systems is an important performance criterion that ensures consistency between the distribution of user preference categories and that of recommendations generated by the system.

item.title: Libra: Building Decoupled Vision System on Large Language Models
item.description: Specifically, we incorporate a routed visual expert with a cross-modal bridge module into a pretrained LLM to route the vision and language flows during attention computing to enable different attention patterns in inner-modal modeling and cross-modal interaction scenarios.

item.title: IRSRMamba: Infrared Image Super-Resolution via Mamba-based Wavelet Transform Feature Modulation Model
item.description: This research advances IR super-resolution and demonstrates the potential of Mamba-based models in IR image processing.

item.title: Histopathology Foundation Models Enable Accurate Ovarian Cancer Subtype Classification
item.description: Five-class classification performance was evaluated through five-fold cross-validation, and these cross-validation models were ensembled for evaluation on a hold-out test set and an external set from the Transcanadian study.

item.title: Bilateral Event Mining and Complementary for Event Stream Super-Resolution
item.description: In this paper, we propose a bilateral event mining and complementary network (BMCNet) to fully leverage the potential of each event and capture the shared information to complement each other simultaneously.

item.title: Language-Oriented Semantic Latent Representation for Image Transmission
item.description: In the new paradigm of semantic communication (SC), the focus is on delivering meanings behind bits by extracting semantic information from raw data.

item.title: DocuMint: Docstring Generation for Python using Small Language Models
item.description: Effective communication, specifically through documentation, is the beating heart of collaboration among contributors in software development.

item.title: MarkLLM: An Open-Source Toolkit for LLM Watermarking
item.description: However, the abundance of LLM watermarking algorithms, their intricate mechanisms, and the complex evaluation procedures and perspectives pose challenges for researchers and the community to easily experiment with, understand, and assess the latest advancements.

item.title: Many-Shot In-Context Learning in Multimodal Foundation Models
item.description: We show that batching up to 50 queries can lead to performance improvements under zero-shot and many-shot ICL, with substantial gains in the zero-shot setting on multiple datasets, while drastically reducing per-query cost and latency.

item.title: Grounding DINO 1.5: Advance the "Edge" of Open-Set Object Detection
item.description: Empirical results demonstrate the effectiveness of Grounding DINO 1. 5, with the Grounding DINO 1. 5 Pro model attaining a 54. 3 AP on the COCO detection benchmark and a 55. 7 AP on the LVIS-minival zero-shot transfer benchmark, setting new records for open-set object detection.

item.title: iDRAMA-Scored-2024: A Dataset of the Scored Social Media Platform from 2020 to 2023
item.description: Online web communities often face bans for violating platform policies, encouraging their migration to alternative platforms.

item.title: Manifold Integrated Gradients: Riemannian Geometry for Feature Attribution
item.description: In this paper, we dive into the reliability concerns of Integrated Gradients (IG), a prevalent feature attribution method for black-box deep learning models.

item.title: Keep It Private: Unsupervised Privatization of Online Text
item.description: Authorship obfuscation techniques hold the promise of helping people protect their privacy in online communications by automatically rewriting text to hide the identity of the original author.

item.title: Enhancing Semantics in Multimodal Chain of Thought via Soft Negative Sampling
item.description: Five methods were applied to generate soft negative samples that shared highly similar text but had different semantics from the original.

item.title: Evaluating Algorithmic Bias in Models for Predicting Academic Performance of Filipino Students
item.description: The best-performing model reached AUC of 0. 75 and weighted F1-score of 0. 79.

item.title: LFED: A Literary Fiction Evaluation Dataset for Large Language Models
item.description: The rapid evolution of large language models (LLMs) has ushered in the need for comprehensive assessments of their performance across various dimensions.

item.title: PIR: Remote Sensing Image-Text Retrieval with Prior Instruction Representation Learning
item.description: Continuing with the above, we propose PIR-CLIP, a domain-specific CLIP-based framework for remote sensing image-text retrieval, to address semantic noise in remote sensing vision-language representations and further improve open-domain retrieval performance.

item.title: Size-invariance Matters: Rethinking Metrics and Losses for Imbalanced Multi-object Salient Object Detection
item.description: This paper explores the size-invariance of evaluation metrics in Salient Object Detection (SOD), especially when multiple targets of diverse sizes co-exist in the same image.

item.title: DeCoDEx: Confounder Detector Guidance for Improved Diffusion-based Counterfactual Explanations
item.description: Deep learning classifiers are prone to latching onto dominant confounders present in a dataset rather than on the causal markers associated with the target class, leading to poor generalization and biased predictions.

item.title: Illumination Histogram Consistency Metric for Quantitative Assessment of Video Sequences
item.description: In this paper, we propose a illumination histogram consistency (IHC) metric to quantitatively and automatically evaluate the illumination consistency of the video sequences.

item.title: Color Space Learning for Cross-Color Person Re-Identification
item.description: The primary color profile of the same identity is assumed to remain consistent in typical Person Re-identification (Person ReID) tasks.

item.title: TimeX++: Learning Time-Series Explanations with Information Bottleneck
item.description: The design of the objective function builds upon the principle of information bottleneck (IB), and modifies the IB objective function to avoid trivial solutions and distributional shift issues.

item.title: Tell Me Why: Explainable Public Health Fact-Checking with Large Language Models
item.description: This paper presents a comprehensive analysis of explainable fact-checking through a series of experiments, focusing on the ability of large language models to verify public health claims and provide explanations or justifications for their veracity assessments.

item.title: MMFusion: Multi-modality Diffusion Model for Lymph Node Metastasis Diagnosis in Esophageal Cancer
item.description: In addition, efficient and effective interactions between multi-modal representations need to be further explored, lacking insightful exploration of prognostic correlation in multi-modality features.

item.title: No More Mumbles: Enhancing Robot Intelligibility through Speech Adaptation
item.description: For this, the robot needs to know how difficult it is for a user to understand spoken language in a particular setting.

item.title: Weakly Supervised Bayesian Shape Modeling from Unsegmented Medical Images
item.description: To address these challenges, we introduce a weakly supervised deep learning approach to predict SSM from images using point cloud supervision.

item.title: Lens functions for exploring UMAP Projections with Domain Knowledge
item.description: The effectiveness of the lens functions is demonstrated in two use cases and their computational cost is analysed in a synthetic benchmark.

item.title: OpenGait: A Comprehensive Benchmark Study for Gait Recognition towards Better Practicality
item.description: To this end, we first develop OpenGait, a flexible and efficient gait recognition platform.

item.title: ReconBoost: Boosting Can Achieve Modality Reconcilement
item.description: This paper explores a novel multi-modal alternating learning paradigm pursuing a reconciliation between the exploitation of uni-modal features and the exploration of cross-modal interactions.

item.title: RSHazeDiff: A Unified Fourier-aware Diffusion Model for Remote Sensing Image Dehazing
item.description: Since remote sensing images contain extensive small-scale texture structures, it is important to effectively restore image details from hazy images.

item.title: CloudS2Mask: A novel deep learning approach for improved cloud and cloud shadow masking in Sentinel-2 imagery
item.description: Precise and efficient cloud and cloud shadow masking methods are required for the automated use of this data.

item.title: RobustMVS: Single Domain Generalized Deep Multi-view Stereo
item.description: To evaluate the generalization results, we build a novel MVS domain generalization benchmark including synthetic and real-world datasets.

item.title: Xmodel-VLM: A Simple Baseline for Multimodal Vision Language Model
item.description: We introduce Xmodel-VLM, a cutting-edge multimodal vision language model.

item.title: From NeRFs to Gaussian Splats, and Back
item.description: For robotics applications where there is a limited number of (typically ego-centric) views, parametric representations such as neural radiance fields (NeRFs) generalize better than non-parametric ones such as Gaussian splatting (GS) to views that are very different from those in the training data; GS however can render much faster than NeRFs.

item.title: Factual Serialization Enhancement: A Key Innovation for Chest X-ray Report Generation
item.description: Additionally, existing methods for similar historical cases retrieval face suboptimal performance owing to the modal gap issue.
